meanings.definition: A promontory or headland projecting into the sea.
meanings.sent1: The ship sailed around the forelands to reach the open ocean.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse was built on the forelands to guide ships safely.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls often gather on the forelands to rest and watch the waves.
meanings.sent4: The forelands stood tall like a guardian at the edge of the vast sea.
meanings.sent5: The crashing waves echoed against the forelands, creating a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: A region of land that lies in front of a mountain range.
meanings.sent1: The forelands provided a beautiful view of the towering mountains in the distance.
meanings.sent2: Hikers often explore the forelands before embarking on the mountain trails.
meanings.sent3: The animals in the forest below often peek up at the forelands, curious about the view.
meanings.sent4: The forelands acted as a shield, protecting the valley from harsh winds.
meanings.sent5: The sunsets from the forelands painted the sky in vibrant hues, casting a magical glow.

meanings.definition: The land that lies before or in front of something.
meanings.sent1: The forelands stretched out before us, leading the way to the unknown.
meanings.sent2: The village was nestled in the forelands, surrounded by lush greenery.
meanings.sent3: The children played hide-and-seek in the forelands, giggling and running around.
meanings.sent4: The forelands acted as a barrier, separating the town from the wild forest beyond.
meanings.sent5: The mist enveloped the forelands, creating an ethereal atmosphere of mystery.
